text: Badminton was contested at the 2015 Summer Universiade from July 6 to 12 at the Hwasun Hanium Culture Sports Center in Hwasun, South Korea. Men's and women's singles, men's, women's, and mixed doubles, and mixed team events will be contested. ==Medal summary== ===Medal table=== South Korea became the overall champion after winning all the events competed, with 6 gold, 2 silver and 1 bronze medals. ===Medal events=== South Korea clinched the individual and the team event. In the mixed team event, they won the title with a comprehensive 3–0 beating China. After the Chinese player, Yu Xiaohan was tested positive for doping violation, her women's doubles silver medal was reallocated, and China was disqualified and the team placings were also reallocated.
